intro: Kralikia africana, commonly known as the African kralikia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrubland and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Kralikia africana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
